document_content.title: Referral for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Porter is being referred for specialist evaluation of persistent fatigue and malaise, present for the past 4 months despite initial management.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports ongoing fatigue, unrefreshing sleep, and intermittent myalgias. She denies fever, significant weight loss, or night sweats. There is no history of recent travel or sick contacts.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No significant chronic illnesses. No known allergies. Up-to-date with routine immunizations.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasional acetaminophen for headaches. No regular prescription medications.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vital signs stable. Physical examination unremarkable except for mild pallor. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent laboratory tests show mild normocytic anemia (Hb 11.5 g/dL), normal thyroid function, negative infectious workup (EBV, CMV, HIV). Liver and renal function within normal limits.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms and inconclusive initial workup, I am referring Ms. Porter for further evaluation to rule out underlying causes such as chronic fatigue syndrome or other systemic conditions.
